Catholic Charities of Jackson, Lenawee & Hillsdale
Dear Ms. Lewis:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?

III. METHODOLOGY

2022C0444009

Emailed Chief Administrator to advise of new complaint
03/24/2022 Contact - Telephone call made

04/19/2022 Pre-exit meeting
ALLEGATION:
Foster parent was not informed by the agency that a special evaluation was initiated.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Complainant stated
she is not aware of a new special evaluation dated March 7, 2022. Complainant
stated she has no idea what the allegations are. Complainant stated the agency
does not notify her to advise her of an investigation, what the allegations are or her
2

right to have a support person present. Complainant clarified this is the case with the
evaluations in September, December and March, which she states she wasn’t aware
of until she was interviewed. Complainant stated she believed on a couple
occasions the workers were there for a regular home visit and had no idea she was
being interviewed for a special evaluation. Complainant stated she records all of her
meetings with the agency which verifies she was not advised of special evaluations
in September 2021, December 2021 or March 2022.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Licensing
Supervisor stated she completed the special evaluation for the September 9, 2021,
intake. Licensing supervisor stated the complainant was notified of the investigation,
advised of her right to have a support person and provided a copy of the special
evaluation report. Licensing supervisor stated everything is documented in
MISACWIS.
Licensing worker was interviewed face to face at the agency on March 28, 2022.
Licensing worker stated the foster home has had 3 special evaluations within the
past year. The most recent special investigation intake was received on March 7,
2022, so nothing is uploaded in MISACWIS yet. Licensing worker stated she met
with the Complainant face-to-face on March 7, 2022, to advise her of the new
special investigation and her right to have a support person present. Licensing
worker stated she copied the alleged rule violation, highlighted relevant information,
and provided to the Complainant in writing. Licensing worker stated the agency has
an understanding that no one is to meet with the Complainant alone. Licensing
worker stated the Chief Administrator was also present on March 7, 2022, when this
information was provided to Complainant.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on March 28, 2022.
Chief Administrator stated she was present for the entire meeting that took place on
March 7, 2022, where the complainant was notified of the special investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
 MiSACWIS Provider Record:
o September 9, 2021, special investigation intake; initiated September 9,
2021; September 22, 2021, foster parent notified of new investigation face
to face.
o December 16, 2021, special investigation intake; initiated December 16,
2021; December 16, 2021, foster parent notified of special investigation
via email.
o March 7, 2022, special investigation intake; initiated March 7, 2022.
o March 7, 2022, social work contact: Face-to-face with foster parent
notifying her of new special investigation due to a call the agency received
from anonymous reporter. Staff provided a printout of alleged rule
violations and explained to her. Social work contact notes the Chief
Administrator was also present.
3

 Agency provided a copy of the email sent to foster parent on December 16,
2022, notifying her of new special investigation. The email did not advise the
Complainant of her right to have a support person present.
 Complainant provided two audio recordings. One recording was 12 minutes and
the second recording was 2 minutes. Twelve-minute recording includes
discussion regarding a special investigation, but it is not clear which
investigation. The recording ends in the middle of the special investigation
discussion. The dates of both recordings could not be verified.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(2) An agency shall inform foster parents of all of the
following before they are questioned or interviewed
regarding a special evaluation:
(a) That a special evaluation has been initiated.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in compliance as staff reported they
informed the Complainant of the investigation and the
MISACWIS provider record documented the complainant was
notified of September 9, 2021, December 16, 2021, and March
7, 2022, special investigations either verbally or in writing. The
audio recordings provided by the complainant did not verify she
was not advised of the investigations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Foster parent was not offered a support person during special investigation.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Complainant stated
she is not aware of a new special investigation dated March 7, 2022. Complainant
stated the agency does not notify her of investigations, what the allegations are or
her right to have a support person present. Complainant clarified this is the case with
the investigations in September, December and March, which she states she wasn’t
aware of. Complainant stated she records all of her meetings which verify she was
not advised of her right to have a support person present.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Licensing
Supervisor stated she completed the special evaluation for intake September 9,
2021. Licensing supervisor stated the complainant was notified of the investigation,
advised of her right to have a support person and provided a copy of the special
evaluation report. Licensing supervisor stated everything is documented in
MISACWIS.
4

Licensing worker was interview face to face at the agency on March 28, 2022.
Licensing worker stated the foster home has had 3 special investigations within the
past year. The most recent special investigation was received on March 7, 2022.
Licensing worker stated she met with the Complainant face-to-face on March 7,
2022, to verbally advise her of the new special investigation and her right to have a
support person present. Licensing worker stated she copied the alleged rule
violation, highlighted relevant information, and provided to the Complainant.
Licensing worker stated the agency has an understanding that no one is to meet
with the Complainant alone. Licensing worker stated the Chief Administrator was
also present on March 7, 2022, when this information was provided to Complainant.
Licensing worker stated she has always informed the Complainant of her right to
have a support person present if she chooses and documented in the special
evaluation report.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on March 28, 2022.
Chief Administrator stated she was present for the entire meeting that took place on
March 7, 2022, where the complainant was notified of the special investigation and
advised of her right to have a support person present if she chooses. Chief
Administrator stated the Complainant has had her attorney present as her support
person during previous special investigations.
Documents Reviewed:
 MiSACWIS Provider Record:
o September 9, 2021, special investigation intake; initiated September 9,
2021; September 22, 2021, foster parent notified of new investigation face
to face and advised of her right to have a support person present.
o December 16, 2021, special investigation intake; initiated December 16,
2021; December 16, 2021, foster parent notified of special investigation
via email. The email does not advise the Complainant of her right to have
a support person present.
o March 7, 2022, special investigation intake; initiated March 7, 2022.
o March 7, 2022, social work contact: Face-to-face with foster parent
notifying her of new special investigation due to a call the agency received
from anonymous reporter. Staff provided a printout of alleged rule
violations and explained to her. Foster parent was also advised of her right
to have a support person present. Social work contact notes the Chief
Administrator was also present.
o Special Evaluation 2022C0630367 completed on March 4, 2022,
documented the Complainant was informed they may have a support
person present on January 21, 2022.
o Special Evaluation 2021C0630229 completed on December 1, 2021,
documented the Complainant was informed they may have a support
person present on September 22, 2021.
5

 Agency provided a copy of the email sent to foster parent on December 16,
2022, notifying her of new special investigation. The email did not advise the
Complainant of her right to have a support person present. The email did not
advise Complainant of her right to have a support person present.
 Complainant provided two audio recordings. One recording was 12 minutes and
the second recording was 2 minutes. Twelve-minute recording includes
discussion regarding a special investigation, but it is not clear which
investigation. The recording ends in the middle of the special investigation
discussion. The dates of both recordings could not be verified.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(2) An agency shall inform foster parents of all of the
following before they are questioned or interviewed
regarding a special evaluation:
(c) That the foster parents may involve a person of their
choice in any interviews with them involving the special
evaluation if the involvement does not impede the timely
completion of the evaluation.
ANALYSIS: The agency is found in compliance as staff reported they
informed the Complainant of her right to have a support person
present and the MISACWIS provider record documented the
complainant was advised of her right to have a support person
present during contact with the Complainant on September 22,
2021, January 21, 2022, and March 7, 2022. The audio
recordings provided by the complainant did not verify she was
not advised of her right to have a support person present.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Foster parent was not provided any documentation regarding special investigation.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Complainant stated
the agency does not notify her if an extension is needed or provide any
documentation when a special evaluation is closed. Complainant clarified this is the
case with the special evaluations in September, December, and March.
Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Licensing
Supervisor stated she completed the special investigation on September 9, 2021.
Licensing supervisor stated the complainant was notified of the investigation,
advised of her right to have a support person and provided a copy of the
6

investigation report. Licensing supervisor stated everything is documented in
MISACWIS.
Licensing worker was interview face to face at the agency on March 28, 2022.
Licensing worker stated the foster home has had 3 special evaluations within the
past year. Licensing worker stated she provided all required documentation for
extensions or completion of the evaluation and all documentation is uploaded into
MISACWIS.
Documents Reviewed:
 MiSACWIS Provider Record:
o September 9, 2021, special investigation intake; October 28, 2021, letter
sent regarding extension; December 2, 2021, closing letter uploaded.
o December 16, 2021, special investigation intake; January 28, 2022,
extension letter sent; March 4, 2022, closing letter uploaded.
o March 7, 2022, special investigation intake; March 7, 2022, social work
contact face-to-face with complainant notifying her of new special
investigation due to a call the agency received from anonymous
reporter. Staff provided a printout of alleged rule violations and explained
to complainant. Complainant was also advised of her right to have a
support person present. Social work contact notes Chief Administrator
was also present. This special investigation is still open.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days
of its completion.
ANALYSIS: There is documentation in the MISACWIS provider record the
complainant was provided a copy of the special evaluation on
December 2, 2021, and March 4, 2022, both within 10 days of
completion. The special investigation closing letter is uploaded
for both special investigations. The special investigation dated
March 7, 2022, has not been completed.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Agency did not follow through on informed consent for Youth A’s medication timely.
INVESTIGATION:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on March 24, 2022. Complainant stated
one of the foster children placed in her home was prescribed medication and the
7

agency has not followed up with her regarding whether or not the prescription can be
filled, and the child can start the medication.
Foster Care worker (FCW) was interviewed via telephone on April 7, 2022. FCW
stated the Complainant contacted her after Youth A’s doctor appointment on March
11, 2022, and informed her via text message the doctor prescribed ADHD
medication. FCW stated she informed the Complainant consent was needed to fill
the prescription. FCW stated she contacted Youth A’s doctor to obtain a summary of
the appointment and confirmed the medication was prescribed and faxed the
psychotropic medication consent form to Youth A’s doctor.
Documents Reviewed:
 MISACWIS Case Record for Youth A: Social work contact dated March 11, 2022.
Complainant sent a text to FCW stating child had her ADHD appointment and
was prescribed a low dose of Ritalin. FCW advised that Foster Care consent
would be needed before the prescription could be filled.
 Social work contact dated March 24, 2022. FCW sent psychotropic medication
consent form to doctor’s office via fax.
 Social work contact dated March 28, 2022. A message was sent to Complainant
in the group chat stating that FCW contacted doctor’s office to request the
Psychotropic Medication Consent form be signed today.
 Social work contact dated March 28, 2022. FCW contacted doctor’s office to
inquire about the Psychotropic Medication Consent form. The receptionist stated
they did receive it. FCW requested they get it back today. The receptionist stated
they don't know when the doctor will be able to get to it. FCW again requested it
to be completed today.
 Social work contact dated March 28, 2022. The Psychotropic Medication
Consent paper was returned by doctor’s office with signature. It was given to the
supervisor for a signature. The supervisor is out of the office. The form will be
given to her on March 29, 2022.
 Social work contact dated March 29, 2022. Complainant was contacted via text
message and informed the child’s prescription for Ritalin was approved.
 Complainant provided screenshot of group text message dated March 11, 2022,
that included FCW. Text message stated child had doctor appt and doctor
prescribed a low dose of Ritalin extended relief. FCW responded and indicated
she would need to send a consent form to the doctor that would need to be
completed and returned before child could start medication.
APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 802-1 Psychotropic medication in foster care
Informed consent documentation must be completed within
seven business days of recommendation of newly
prescribed psychotropic medication.
8

ANALYSIS: The agency is found in non-compliance as the agency did not
complete the informed consent documentation within seven
business days as required. Foster parent provided a text
message verifying the agency was made aware of Youth A’s
new psychotropic prescription on March 11, 2022 but did not
send the psychotropic medication consent form to the doctor’s
office until March 24, 2022.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be made to the
license status of this child placing agency.
